alert.note: Alert for Arlington; City of Alexandria; City of Fairfax; City of Falls Church; Fairfax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 3:58AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of DC and northern Virginia, including the following counties: in DC, District of Columbia. In northern Virginia, Arlington, City of Alexandria, City of Fairfax, City of Falls Church and Fairfax. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arlington... Alexandria... Annandale... Fairfax... Vienna... Falls Church... Rosslyn... Crystal City... Oakton... Lincolnia... Tysons Corner... Merrifield... Lake Barcroft... Ballston... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Arlington; City of Alexandria; City of Fairfax; City of Falls Church; Fairfax
